KnowledgeBase.Title: Example Character compareGE 010
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: compare compareEQ compareNE compareGT compareLT compareLE

Example.Description: These examples use the compareGE function to compare two objects and return the Boolean value true if the first argument is greater than or equal to the second argument or false if otherwise. The Integer argument is converted into Character values.

Syntax.Note: The character, a, has an ASCII value of 97
